recommendations.reason: Comedy anime with an invincible, reserved protagonist trying to get through his regular day to day life. Need I say more?
Both share the same initial setup: The demon lord has been defeated, and has now resurrected after a long time, during which the rules of the world have changed
Time travel shenanigans with a useless MC and a colorful cast of characters and as a bonus the names of the MCs are similar, Yuuki and Yuuri

Both series are about high-school life with a twist, and focus heavily on the character's powers and unique abilities. The MCs - Deku and Iruma - are also similar in personality. Their struggles are also alike, as they have to navigate life surrounded by powerful friends and foes. Furthermore, a lot of the other characters follow similar archetypes. Both are enjoyable, light shows in general.

recommendedAnime.title: Kao ni Denai Kashiwada-san to Kao ni Deru Oota-kun

recommendations.reason: The female lead in both anime show little to no expression, but still very adorable. The comedy and vibes are also kind of similar. If you like one of these, you might like the other one!

as its been said before gintama is the best comedy and so its spin off is some thing i would recommend. If u arnt sure about starting gintama this can be a good gate way in, but there r jokes and all u may not get coz its referencing the og show
still funny asf

a funnier and better saiki k trust, if u like saiki u will love gintama
a show with not just comedy but great plots, fights, characters, message, the father of comedy animes
gintama
Resurrection and its consequences
while the plots are very different, both are psychological thriller. good characters, good story and great suspense. i feel like if you liked monster, you'd like death note as well.

i think its pretty obvious why i'd suggest code geass to a death note fan. the mcs and their goals are similar. although they are of different genres, i would totally suggest code geass if you enjoyed death note.
Another josei series about fashion and great characters but more of a romance and drama focus over comedy.

recommendedAnime.title: Watari-kun no xx ga Houkai Sunzen

recommendations.reason:
渡くんの××が崩壊寸前 (Watari's XX Is on the Brink of Collapse) has characters designed similar to Gimai Seikatsu:

- Stoic blonde girl who becomes obsessed with the protagonist
- MC is independent for his age
- The adults' point of view creates tension in the teenagers' relationship.

Both are dark fantasy isekai anime that follow protagonists who start off naïve and optimistic but soon discover that being trapped in another world isn't at all like the grand adventure they thought it would be, becoming more cynical as a result. Additionally, Subaru and Naofumi are quite weak on their own and need a lot of help from others in order to get anything done. They also often feel like they're unwanted and are a little TOO eager to speak their mind. However, Subaru is generally friendly to the majority of people (if a little obnoxious at times) while Naofumi is generally rude and aloof to anyone he doesn't consider a close friend.

Priscilla and Malty are also quite alike, in that they're both red-haired, arrogant women who have the ambition of becoming the queen of their country and believe that everyone should bow to them, though Priscilla has more morals and standards than Malty does... in that she actually has any morals and standards AT ALL.

I personally think both shows are brilliant, and would recommend them to anyone who enjoys a twist on the isekai genre.
Bunch of young people stranded in a spaceship while finding it hard to trust each other

Both are dark fantasy shonen anime revolving around a group of people who protect humanity from demonic beings (in "Fire Force", Infernals are combusted humans while in "Blue Exorcist", Demons are just monsters from hell). In both shows, the protagonist is a kind-hearted teenage boy with fire-based powers who is often compared to a devil, but they outright reject this label and desire to become a hero instead. In both cases, their allies include a stern, bespectacled man who acts as their immediate superior (Hinawa is Shinra's Lieutenant while Yukio is Rin's exorcist instructor) and a blonde-haired nice girl who acts as the team's emotional centre (Iris/Shiemi). 

Basically, if you like one, you will almost definitely like the other.

Both shows are action fantasy anime about warring nations that follow a red-haired protagonist with an upper-class background (Tigre is a noble while Yona is a princess) who start off with a rather easy life but circumstances result in them getting pulled into the conflict of the series. They're also both expert archers, though Tigre is one from the beginning while it takes a while for Yona to become one. Both shows are also very dark and action-packed, but also not opposed to humour at times.

That said, "Yona of the Dawn" is as good or better than "Lord Marksman and Vanadis" in just about every way. As such, if you like the latter, you will definitely like the former.
both breat htaking anime designs about ppl trapped in space

While Maou 2099 leans more into an Isekai vibe (there's a division on whether it actually qualifies as one) with a Demon Lord wanting to regain his powers while making a living as a Streamer, MayoPunch leans a little more into the comedy and behind the scenes of a bunch of quirky Vampires starting a YouTube channel.
Both shows feature the daily struggles and conflicts of content creators trying to gain popularity, so if you enjoy that sort of theme, they're both easy watches.

recommendedAnime.title: Debu to Love to Ayamachi to!

recommendations.reason: A girl who's overweight but goes through transformation that changes their life and people surrounding them. Theyre both very kind, funny, optimistic individuals who experiences romance in the series.

sourceAnime.title: Debu to Love to Ayamachi to!

recommendations.reason: Female character who goes through an identity change and their life becomes better. They are surrounded by romance and a new group of friends who loves them for them. MC learns to accept themselves throughout the series and learn self love.

recommendedAnime.title: Debu to Love to Ayamachi to!

recommendations.reason: mc looses their memories and went from a gloomy person to an upbeat, positive, funny individual. People who viewed them negatively slowly realizes their charm
shounen, boy who has to get stronger to get where he needs to be, got alot of women that fawn over him.

Imo, Dandadan is a superior version of FLCL (Furi Kuri), aka - how Furi Kuri actually was supposed to be. Both have great animation, are really crazy at moments and have dynamic action instances. MCs can also be viewed as somewhat similar. But Dandadan is so much more + is better in like all fields... Furi Kuri was too fast-paced and crazy to a point where the story did not make sense. Dandadan has slower tempo and reasonable story, while maintaining Furi Kuri pluses.
In both works, transcendent divine omnipotence is merely a pretext for confusion and humor.

sourceAnime.title: Sakurako-san no Ashimoto ni wa Shitai ga Umatteiru

recommendations.reason: in both series, the main characters are cold and cool characters, they are happy when they solve murders and mysteries that others cannot solve.

Both series are shounen and their character designs, characters' powers and battles are very similar to each other. Yuu Yuu Hakusho is actually a bit similar to other shounen genres like Naruto and Bleach. i recommend you to watch it.
Both series are about spies taking care of children. Both are sweet and fun series.

- full cgi
- western fantasy
- ensemble cast
Post apocalyptic setting, 2 of the most amazing soundtracks you'll ever hear in anime, dark tone and heavy story, worldbuilding is a major focus in both. Mature themes explored.
The second short of Mechano could have perfectly fit into the Compu Movie compilation. For fans of early CGI.
They're both epilepsy-inducing surreal 1990's 3D animations with electronic music. Shinkansen is just a song though and Compu Movie is a compilation. For fans of early CGI.

Both shows deal with characters getting isekai'd and having to gain followers to grow in power. Kamikatsu focuses more on comedy and action, while Demon Lord 2099 is more action then comedy. If you like a MC who's confident even when a challenge seems way over his head in a whole new world, I recommend!

Both shows deal with the MC having to gain fans and followers to get powerful. While it's trust in To Be Hero X, it's streaming viewers in Demon Lord 2099.  If you liked the street fights with supernatural abilities in one show, your sure to get more of that in the other.

Ruri Rocks gives you that same feeling of warmth when watching the characters of A Place Further Than The Universe interact with their enviroment; this alongside the visuals and soundtrack gives it that same amazing "wow factor"

Both shows deal with two clans fighting in some sort of all-goes-by battle royale to prevail over the other. Difference is that in Basilisk both clans are ninja, while in Ninja to Gokudou is instead a ninja vs yakuza conflict.

recommendedAnime.title: Chi. Chikyuu no Undou ni Tsuite

recommendations.reason:
-Both worlds kill the questioning mind before it can bloom. 

-Every character who asks questions in both shows are branded as "dangerous"

-Both of these stories treat the truth as a revolutionary act of sorts

Same war, different battleground~
Both seek answers to the hard question of self-sacrifice and the meaning of life. Sounds cheesy, but that#s what both of them do.

Very similar vibe. Similar female MC, Similar slice of life romance with beautiful nothings of everyday life. Some how art style also feels very similar.
Highly recommend watching both.

Idolish7 and A3 are both anime with extremely charming characters and stories that will suck you right in. Both focus on the relationships between the male characters and their backstories, each of them overcoming their past and fears, helping each other out and uniting for their dreams. Why I this these 2 are more similar compared to the other anime in the same genre is the amount of depth and drama. There are many character tropes that very much overlap with each other. If you like the characters from idolish7, you will also love the characters from a3. The female lead in both are also their manager, or director, a role that keeps them as a respectable and major character in the boys' lives, while also allowing them to have more interaction with each other.

recommendations.reason: Both series involve a character with memories from Earth, ending up in a fantasy world where they are tasked with building alliances, finding allies, managing towns/nations, and leading armies in battle.

recommendedAnime.title: Yasei no Last Boss ga Arawareta!

recommendations.reason:
- player transmigrated into new world as game character
- player's base exists in the new world
- sentient NPCs
- NPCs are loyal to player

Both characters are on an adventure in countryside, meeting people as they go. Ginko travels solo but has people he goes to meet on his journey. Freiren lives a painfully long life as an elf so she has stretches of time where she had friends she could travel with. Both has the same, peaceful vibe, subtle colors, soft music.

recommendedAnime.title: Code Geass: Hangyaku no Lelouch R2

recommendations.reason: it is a similar plot where the main character gets a power and uses it to 'fix' the world no matter the cost sososo good!

sourceAnime.title: Shin no Nakama ja Nai to Yuusha no Party wo Oidasareta node, Henkyou de Slow Life suru Koto ni Shimashita

recommendedAnime.title: Kaiko sareta Ankoku Heishi (30-dai) no Slow na Second Life

recommendations.reason:
1. Both have similar premises of the "Banishement" theme. 
2. Both have MCs who are humble characters, who can think through things maturely. 
3. Both have FMCs who are strong and competent. 
4. Both have decent romances between main pairs.
5. Both premises have the Slow-Life atmosphere going around in them.
6. The setting for both series takes place in the countryside. 

"Shin no Nakama ja Nai to Yuusha no Party wo Oidasareta node, Henkyou de Slow Life suru Koto ni Shimashita" can sometimes feel heavy-hearted, despite the lightness of the series. Though, those conflicting scenarios do not distract the series from its initial premise and payoff remains on the positive side. 

"Kaiko sareta Ankoku Heishi (30-dai) no Slow na Second Life" also has conflicts in the plot but it doesn't become serious enough to hinder the wholesomeness. 

All n all, both of them are laid-back enjoyable watch, where you don't have to beat your head on the wall for some unnecessary forced drama and less annoying side characters are also a plus.

sourceAnime.title: Isekai Yururi Kikou: Kosodate shinagara Boukensha shimasu

recommendations.reason:
[Comparison is as of Ep3 of A Gatherer's Adventure in Isekai, may be subjected to future amendments when the show ends]

Both shows feature a relaxing and lighthearted vibe with an overpowered MC journeying through an Isekai world with minimal conflicts and lots of feel good moments as they interact with the supporting cast and traveling around.

The main difference is that A Journey Through Another World focuses on the MC with a pair of children, while A Gatherer's Adventure in Isekai have an MC who is a gatherer adventuring with a Dragon familiar.
If you are fan of Nichijou or City The Animation, you will love this anime. Same autor, same animation studio, same humor.

Both deal with the psychology of sports, finding your place in the world after your sports career is over, and delve into the philosophy of how sports and games are microcosms of life. Also, both have very similar stylistic sensibilities in terms of the music that they employ, as well as their own unique yet beautiful art and animation styles. If you love one of these works, you're almost sure to love the other.

recommendedAnime.title: Yasei no Last Boss ga Arawareta!

recommendations.reason: Both MCs have the same vibe with 2 sides, the irl still being the main site, but sometimes the game site takes the lead. Both funny in they way the MC interacts wit the world.

recommendations.reason: My Dress-Up Darling and Danjo no Yuujou wa Seiritsu suru have several similarities. The romance in both is built around the protagonists' hobbies. The female character is popular and extremely beautiful, while the male protagonist is more reserved and introverted. In addition, both focus on a high school romance.
The main similarities between these two series are the striking neon palette visual style, cartoonish violence, and overpowered characters who are indifferent.
UU feels like a modern 'tribute' to HxH, with Tozuka openly acknowledging its inspiration. If you like HxH, UU could be a great recommendation for a fresh take on the same genre!

recommendedAnime.title: Chi. Chikyuu no Undou ni Tsuite

recommendations.reason:
- Takes place in Medieval Europe
- Realistic with mature, serious storytelling
- Focus on philosophical themes like morality and purpose of life
- Shows the influence of religion and how it affects human thought
- Similar vibe in terms of setting and art style

The similarity between the main characters is uncanny. Keima (TWGOK) is obsessed with dating sims and uses the scenarios of those games to solve real life situations (conquering girls), while Cid (Eminence) is obsessed with magic and power fantasy, thinking of him as a mysterious hero who operates from the shadows. Their monologues are also extremely similar. They also have near zero interest in irl romance.
both mcs are overpowered and try to hide their powers
The plot is very similar, unbelievable OP main character + quirky cast. Genre too.

recommendedAnime.title: Dungeon ni Deai wo Motomeru no wa Machigatteiru Darou ka V: Houjou no Megami-hen

recommendations.reason: Both Grimgar and Danmachi immerse their viewers in a fantasy world where the MC has to overcome hardship and fight their way to the top. While Danmachi does this in more of an ambitious/heroic way Grimgar focuses more on the harsh realities of sending a bunch of summons to a fantasy world. They frame the same journey both the MCs take in two different ways. They also focus on how sometimes the MC cannot do it alone, relying on their party members to cover for their shortcomings. Both anime do this VERY well! Both MCs also struggle to get stronger knowing if they want to achieve their goals they MUST continue forward.

both anime about:

- group of people within a closed space/building
- are being eliminated one by one
- have trials to find the murderer
They both are CGDCT and slice of live which involves girls traveling in nature.

A small countryside village where a curse is taking place, causing people to die due to a supernatural entity in the form of a person. These two anime share the exact same creepy atmosphere, dark color palettes, heavy shading, abrupt camera angles, and the same vibe of utter uneasiness caused by the claustrophobia of the rural setting that floods you whenever you're watching it.

recommendations.reason: These are works that use beast people to discuss oppression and relationships that are not accepted in society. They are both excellent at exploring their respective worlds as they explore what a world with beast people would be like, even though they are very different in their approaches, as "Beastars" is an all-beast-people world, with "With You, Our Love Will Make It Through" being a world that started without any beast-people but science created beast-people.

recommendedAnime.title: Shinjiteita Nakama-tachi ni Dungeon Okuchi de Korosarekaketa ga Gift "Mugen Gacha" de Level 9999 no Nakama-tachi wo Te ni Irete Moto Party Member to Sekai ni Fukushuu & "Zamaa!" Shimasu!

recommendations.reason:
Both are set in a fantasy world containing diverse races and with a magic system similar to that of an MMORPG video game.

In both, the main character is extremely powerful, practically invincible, and commands a large army of other characters of all types who live within a large palace that he rules like a king.

The biggest difference between the two is that one character is trapped inside the world of a game while the other becomes stronger to later seek revenge for what was done to him.

The biggest similarity is that both are overpowered and will always use all the means they have to achieve their goals.
Their main subject may seem different but if you liked Frieren, I guess this is bc the emotions it gave. If that's the case, you will definitely love Natsume. Pls give it a try.
Femc has medical expertise and romance develops similarly.

recommendations.reason:
Both about senpai training someone new.
Both a office romance.

Both stories are about a girl who's pretty much socially awkward and not used to communicating with people they don't know and how they get to know their classmates and make the cutest friend group ever. The love interest in both series is really gentle and cares very deeply for the FMC. Overall they're both really feel-good animes that give you faith in humanity. I'd say if you like the found family trope and the cozy-everyone-is-so-nice vibes in any of these you'll probably enjoy the other a whole lot.
Both series have magical/mystical elements, leaded by female characters with a special relationship and something to accomplish.

Similarities: Both are romantic comedies. Both feature a debt-ridden protagonist who must work as a maid to pay off their debts.

Both feature a boss with a difficult personality and the opposite sex: Arthur is a boss in Kikaijikake no Marie, and Nagi is a boss in Hayate no Gotoku.
and little by little may employees and bosses develop feelings for each other.
Both has other characters who helps sometimes the protagonists.


Differences: In Hayate no Gotoku, the protagonist (Hayate) is male and works as a butler.

In Kikaijikake no Marie, the protagonist (Marie) is female and works as a maid, pretending to be a robot.

If you enjoy light, funny comedies with a touch of romance, you might like this two.
This is another good harem anime, I like the male lead character in this anime, one of the best protagonist in rom-com.

Not to mention that the character design for both men is very similar. Both older men with brown hair and muscular body.
Both have touching stories about love that are so interesting to watch.

Both shows follow a band of girls navigating life together. I enjoyed both shows thoroughly and watched them at the same time as they were coming out! Very cute and heart warming while also emotional and touching. For those who love music and the stories of friendship.

recommendations.reason: Both have a superhuman or spiritual Guardian defending and teaching them about the world. Both have a group of people who are supportive of an infant or someone young. Both characters not wanting but feel a responsibility of taking care of young one.
Platinum end is also an anime about trying to become a God to destroy the earth because of resentment, so it's similar themes to this one.
The fight to become god and destroy the world is similar. Mirai Nikki execute it better, but the overall themes are similar.

recommendedAnime.title: Ansatsusha de Aru Ore no Status ga Yuusha yori mo Akiraka ni Tsuyoi no da ga

recommendations.reason:
> Iseaki
> Whole Class gets teleported into another world
> Mc is a loner
> Mc is strategic, tactical and knows how to adapt in certain situations. Can be reliable.

Even though both anime have very similar setups, "My Status as an Assassin" is more of a dark genre. On the other hand, "Hitoribocchi no Isekai (Loner life in another world)" is a happy genre where the classmates all laugh and cry together. Lastly, I'd like to add I recommend these anime because their setup with "the whole class getting isekai'd" is the same, they might not be able to provide a similar natured entertainment.

recommendedAnime.title: Ansatsusha de Aru Ore no Status ga Yuusha yori mo Akiraka ni Tsuyoi no da ga

recommendations.reason:
Being an isekai, additionally the whole class getting transported in another world, these two animes have more similarities to offer than just 2.

First of all, both anime themes are very similar - the MC of these animes had very little impact in their previous world, they were what we call background characters in their own world. Anyone would hardly notice them. Even after going into another world they were not very chummy with the people around them; in case of "Kumo Desu Ka" Mc was disconnected to people for a long time before finally coming out and for "My Status as an Assassin" Mc chose to hide his pressence.
Secondly, both these animes have a dark theme setup. In these animes they show the corrupted side of the isekai world that our heros got transported in. Cruel reality and murder is common here. We also have demon lords, monsters, dungeons and various species.
There is a major difference in these two animes, in "My Status as an Assassin" they teleported to another world in their original body and age but in "Kumo Desu Ka" they simply reincarnated as a child becoming different species in another world.
If you liked one of these animes give the other one a try as well.

sourceAnime.title: Shinka no Mi: Shiranai Uchi ni Kachigumi Jinsei

recommendedAnime.title: Ansatsusha de Aru Ore no Status ga Yuusha yori mo Akiraka ni Tsuyoi no da ga

recommendations.reason:
Gag comedy with isekai adventure, the underrated anime "Shinka no Mi" is very much alike "My Status as an Assassin".
It is purely because of three things,
> Whole class gets Isekai'd in another wolrd
> MC was a background character in his previous world but becomes OP in this new world
> MC gets separated from the kingdom that summoned them and gets stronger on his own getting various powers, skills [and picks up waifus on his way].

Other than these, both of the anime stories are completely opposite to each other where "Shinka no Mi" is very comical and easy-going, "My Status as an Assassin" is a dark isekai fantasy. The beginnings of both of these animes are very similar. Even though can not think highly of "Shinka no Mi" season 2, season one is watchable. Do give it a try if you like one of these animes.
Both dive into the best animation and rich in colors, both have the biggest plot twist that'll probably break your heart
Both have immersive complex worldbuilding and a sense of uncovering history and secrets of the past.
High school romance anime. Both female protagonists share their love for a boy since before they were in high school.
Both are romance anime set in a school setting. They share a similar vibe. The main female character falls for the popular boy at school.

recommendedAnime.title: Kaoru Hana wa Rin to Saku

recommendations.reason: If you liked Horimiya, you’ll probably love Kaoru Hana wa Rin to Saku. Both series share several similarities: The protagonists come from seemingly different worlds, but gradually find common ground. Both stories focus on school romances, filled with light and realistic moments. They turn simple, everyday moments into something meaningful and unforgettable.

recommendedAnime.title: Chi. Chikyuu no Undou ni Tsuite

recommendations.reason:
This might not be the best recommendation, but i feel like they rae quit similare. The biggest similaritie is the Dark main theme and the somewhat supense drama, death is, compared to shonon, an important thing and not really taken light. 
If you compare them side by side they don't seem similare at all, especially the main topic, with Orb having a brutal fight between beliefers and scientists, compared to Monster a fight between a "Monster" and justice. But both anime have a deep psycological involvemt for the viewer and the character, this makes them somewhat equal deep and i think in this cases lies the biggest similaritiy

Both anime feature main characters (Hajime and Eiko) that were music enthusiasts who experienced with conflicting parents. The slight difference here is that unlike EIKO's mother, Hajime's mother did not forbid him to play violin.

Both titles are heartwarming and easy-to-watch.
